channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Poor/dangerouse road surface between Island near church road and no 87 hook lane, 7th February
item.description:
Road surface s very poor along this stretch deep pot holes starting at island going to bus stop near no 87. Danger to children crossing road to get to school and on and off buses at stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged dropped surface around all drains, 7th February
item.description:
Damaged and dropped surfaces around all four drain covered between barbers and worths bakery So dropped cars are swerving to avoid and rain fall covering how deep so also danger to public crossing road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling High Street, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stubbs Drive, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Uneven paving floods preventing safe dry access to home, 7th February
item.description:
Uneven paving causes huge puddles outside 28 Cromwell rd every time it rains meaning we cannot access our house without getting feet wet. School children use this pavement daily for Balgowan school next door and have to step onto the road to avoid the puddles which is dangerous. Please can it be sorted out. Surrounding housing paving is even and unaffected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large, Deep pothole by the Pedestrian Crossing outside Matalan Erith Store, 7th February
item.description:
A large deep pothole has been created by the inclement weather and the continued buses running over the damage. Its by the pedestrian crossing adjacent to the Matalan Store in Erith. While not an immediate danger to the public, there is every chance that damage to vehicles driving over it is a real risk. Would arrangements be put in place to repair the damaged road as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colebrook Street, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large & Deep Pothole, 7th February
item.description:
Deep pothole in lane 2 in line with the SOS phone 5835A. Looking on Google maps it appears to have been repaired before and has been there for sometime (you can see it from 6 months ago online). This has caused damage to one of my wheels & tyres (only been on the car a week!).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M25, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish flytipped, 7th February
item.description:
Large black bin bags dumped on pavement. Foxes have been at them during the night and now rubbish all over pavement and road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: URGENT! Dangerous potholes. Bicycle crashed down potholes in the dark this morning and wheel was damaged and tyre punctured and cyclist thrown. These potholes have been reported but not fixed. Please deal with this urgently before more damage and injuries occur., 7th February
item.description:
URGENT! Dangerous potholes. Bicycle crashed down potholes in the dark this morning and wheel was damaged and tyre punctured and cyclist thrown. These potholes have been reported but not fixed. Please deal with this urgently before more damage and injuries occur.

item.title: Ladders Arnold est bin area by Marquis of wellington, 7th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweeney Crescent, Bermondsey, Greater London
